justification: The study measured self-performance estimates (SPEs) as a form of metacognition using both a BDM auction and a self-reported rating on a Likert scale. These methods were used to assess participants' confidence in their decision-making abilities across different tasks.
The BDM auction procedure allowed participants to bid for the chance to complete additional trials, serving as an incentive-compatible way to measure their global self-performance estimates.
Participants also rated their self-performance estimates on a 6-point Likert scale, providing a direct self-reported measure of their confidence in completing additional trials.
